verbs.description: [ARG0: supreme court] [V: set] [ARG2: to consider hearings in key] [ARG1: cases the connecticut case involves susette kelo pink house on the thames river in new london and whether the city of new london can take her land away and sell it to real estate developers because they promise to pay more taxes and create jobs by converting the neighborhood into trendy condominiums garre says many constitutional scholars consider the phrase public use to restrict government takings to uses that are directly owned or primarily used by the general public such as roads bridges or public buildings federal] judges throughout the country have been grappling with the legality of federal sentencing guidelines since the high court ruled june 24 that a similar sentencing system used by the state of washington was unconstitutional in that case blakely v washington the high court ruled 5 - 4 that washington state sentencing system violated a person right to a trial by jury because it allowed judges to make findings on factors that were never presented to jurors connecticut supreme court washington connecticut gregory g garre supreme court william rehnquist

[ARG0: supreme court] set to [V: consider] [ARG1: hearings in key cases the connecticut case involves susette kelo pink house on the thames river in new london and whether the city of new london can take her land away and sell it to real estate developers because they promise to pay more taxes and create jobs by converting the neighborhood into trendy condominiums garre says many constitutional scholars consider the phrase public use to restrict government takings to uses that are directly owned or primarily used by the general public such as roads bridges or public buildings federal judges throughout the country have been grappling with the legality of federal sentencing guidelines since the high court ruled june 24 that a similar sentencing system used by the state of washington was unconstitutional in that case blakely v washington the high court ruled 5 - 4 that washington state sentencing system violated a person right to a trial by jury because it allowed judges to make findings on factors that were never presented] to jurors connecticut supreme court washington connecticut gregory g garre supreme court william rehnquist

supreme court set to consider hearings in key cases [ARG2: the connecticut case] [V: involves] [ARG1: susette kelo pink house on the thames river in new london] and whether the city of new london can take her land away and sell it to real estate developers because they promise to pay more taxes and create jobs by converting the neighborhood into trendy condominiums garre says many constitutional scholars consider the phrase public use to restrict government takings to uses that are directly owned or primarily used by the general public such as roads bridges or public buildings federal judges throughout the country have been grappling with the legality of federal sentencing guidelines since the high court ruled june 24 that a similar sentencing system used by the state of washington was unconstitutional in that case blakely v washington the high court ruled 5 - 4 that washington state sentencing system violated a person right to a trial by jury because it allowed judges to make findings on factors that were never presented to jurors connecticut supreme court washington connecticut gregory g garre supreme court william rehnquist

supreme court set to consider hearings in key cases the connecticut case involves susette kelo pink house on the thames river in new london and whether the city of new london [V: can] take her land away and sell it to real estate developers because they promise to pay more taxes and create jobs by converting the neighborhood into trendy condominiums garre says many constitutional scholars consider the phrase public use to restrict government takings to uses that are directly owned or primarily used by the general public such as roads bridges or public buildings federal judges throughout the country have been grappling with the legality of federal sentencing guidelines since the high court ruled june 24 that a similar sentencing system used by the state of washington was unconstitutional in that case blakely v washington the high court ruled 5 - 4 that washington state sentencing system violated a person right to a trial by jury because it allowed judges to make findings on factors that were never presented to jurors connecticut supreme court washington connecticut gregory g garre supreme court william rehnquist

supreme court set to consider hearings in key cases the connecticut case involves susette kelo pink house on the thames river in new london and whether [ARG0: the city of new london] [ARGM-MOD: can] [V: take] [ARG1: her land] [ARGM-DIR: away] and sell it to real estate developers because they promise to pay more taxes and create jobs by converting the neighborhood into trendy condominiums garre says many constitutional scholars consider the phrase public use to restrict government takings to uses that are directly owned or primarily used by the general public such as roads bridges or public buildings federal judges throughout the country have been grappling with the legality of federal sentencing guidelines since the high court ruled june 24 that a similar sentencing system used by the state of washington was unconstitutional in that case blakely v washington the high court ruled 5 - 4 that washington state sentencing system violated a person right to a trial by jury because it allowed judges to make findings on factors that were never presented to jurors connecticut supreme court washington connecticut gregory g garre supreme court william rehnquist
